comments.text:
Similar to bug 533928, but for threads, rather than folders.

Current behavior
----------------
If a collapsed thread has unread messages, the thread does not appear in bold, and there is no visual indicator that some of the child messages are unread. Clicking the arrow to expand the thread reveals all the child messages, some of which are bold, indicating that they are unread.

Desired behavior
----------------
If a collapsed thread has unread messages, there is a visual indicator, like a "new" icon next to the thread subject line, or the subject line appearing in bold.

Rationale
---------
When threads in a folder are viewed collapsed, it is not obvious which threads contain unread items. The only way to determine where the unread items are is to manually expand each collapsed thread until all the unread items are discovered. This is an undesirable user experience.
